titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Lewis F Duggins
CWG7381

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Grayson Circuit Court sct
November Term 1865
No 224C
Commonwealth Plff
vs } Indictment for Selling Liquor to Minor
Lewis F Duggins Deft

This day Came the attorney for the Commonwealth and the Deft filed a Demurer to Indictment Demurer Overruled to which Opinion ^of^ the Court Deft excepts, Deft filed Plea not guilty and thereupon Came a Jury towit: James R White, H C Thomas, E. E. Veech, Isaac Pirtle, Thos O. Hill, W. H. Parrish, Amos Stinson, Henry Kerr, Augustin Higdon, Elijah Clubb, John Cubbage, George Horn, Who were Sworn to try the issue Joined, and Returned the following verdict towit; We of the Jury find the Defendant Guilty
John S Cubbage one of the Jury

It is therefore adjudged by the Court that the Commonwealth Recover against the Deft the Sum of fifty Dollars as a fine for said offensce also her Cost herein Expended & may have Execution &C, There was appended With the verdict of the Jury the following. We of the Jury that tried the within Indictment. Resepectfully ask the Govenor to Remit, the fine against the Deft, the proof Was that, the minor to Whom the liquor was sold was at the time, a married
man, with a Child, house Keeping, and Keeping a house of entertainment on premises belonging to the Defendant, He was nineteen Years Old, So that the Deft, might have had no Knowledge that he was a minor, and Was not therefore guilty of a violation of the Spirit of the Act, but was Caught by the letter, Wherefore we ask the fine may be Remitted

John S. Cubbage, foreman
A. Copy Att Edwin Thomas Clerk
Grayson Circuit Court
By R. E. Yates D. C

Grayson Cir Ct
vs
Lewis F. Duggin
$50
Selling to Minor
Remitted 18 Jany 1866
Remit
